data.enText: a long line of rocks or sand near the surface of the sea
a part of a sail that can be tied or rolled up to make the sail smaller in a strong wind
to make a sail smaller by tying or rolling up part of it
data.chText: 收帆；卷起缩帆部；叠起缩帆部

tr: one of several strips across a sail that can be taken in or rolled up to lessen the area of the sail that is exposed to the wind
a submerged ridge of rock or coral near the surface of the water
reduce (a sail) by taking in a reef
roll up (a portion of a sail) in order to reduce its area

example.ex: An unspoilt coral reef encloses the bay.
example.tran: 未受破坏的珊瑚礁环绕在海湾周围。

value.def: A reef is a long line of rocks or sand, the top of which is just above or just below the surface of the sea.

trans: 大堡礁；澳大利亚大堡礁；澳大利亚的大堡礁；堡礁
